metadata.description: An infiltration game made with Unity.

content.title: Zer0 Day
content.tagline: An infiltration game about revealing your environment.

content.paragraph:
Zer0 Day is an infiltration game set in a computer. As a virus, your task is identify and destroy nodes to infiltrate networks.
The core concept revolve around the player-character' ability to map the environment using a sonar.
By holding and releasing a trigger, the player radiates beads that, upon colliding with the environment, reveal the the obstacles and limits of the terrain.

The project was made over the course of one trimester with a small team of students (game design and programming courses).
The assignement was to create an infiltration game with an unique core-mechanic and ten minutes of gameplay including obstacles and enemies.
Aside from Unity, we used a couple of tools to design the levels and the inteface, namely the Adobe suite.
This project was the end of year project of our preparatory class.
